metadata.title: CVE-2019-10224 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw has been found in 389-ds-base versions 1.4.x.x before 1.4.1.3. Whenexecuted in verbose mode, the dscreate and dsconf commands may displaysensitive information, such as the Directory Manager password. An attacker,able to see the screen or record the terminal standard error output, coulduse this flaw to gain sensitive information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10224` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.4.1.5-1
389-ds-base - 1.4.1.5-1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.4.1.5-1
cockpit-389-ds - 1.4.1.5-1
python3-lib389 - 1.4.1.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.1.5-1').
